results.title: The Mammalian story: the beginning of life (Japan)
results.creator_credit: Rokuro Hayashi, Cine-science and Jun-Ichiro Takeda
results.brief_description: Examines the development of the mammal. Considers aspects of cell division and the nature of chromosomes and heredity. Looks in detail at the reproductive organs of the male and female, fertilization and the growth of the embryo. This film makes excellent use of photomicrography to record development of the embryo. Narrated by Brian McInerney.

results.title: The Mammalian heart
results.creator_credit: A K Lee, D Moyan, Australian Academy of Science and Educational Media International
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “The Web of life”.
Illustrates the structure and functioning of the mammalian heart by using the hearts of a sheep and a dog as examples. The sheep’s heart is used to show external features and internal structure, while the appearance of a living heart is seen during a chest operation on a dog at a veterinary clinic. The passage of blood through the heart, lungs and major vessels is observed through X-ray process. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: A K Lee, D Moyan, Australian Academy of Science and Educational Media International

results.title: The Mambo kings
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, La Studia Canal, Regency Enterprises, Alcor Films, Arnon Milchan and Arne Glimcher
results.brief_description: It is the early fifties and with a suitcase full of songs and hearts full of passion, two brothers leave Cuba and come to America in search of their Dream. They start a band and play the Mambo, Samba and Cha-cha in a nightclub every night. This is the story of their quest for show business fame based on the Pulitzer Prize winning “The Mambo Kings play Songs of Love” by Oscar Hjuelos. This film abounds with exciting Latin American music and fascinating footage of the “I Love Lucy” show is matched with footage of the brothers when their big break arrives. Stars Armand Assante and Antonio Banderas.

results.title: The Maltese falcon (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Henry Blanke and John Huston
results.brief_description: In this classic Humphrey Bogart film noir, John Huston sketches a dark cynical world with painfully deep perception. Sam Spade, Dashiell Hammett’s archetypal private eye, is caught in the desperate search for the jewelled falcon of Malta. Spade’s pursuit of his partner’s killer leads him to a group of individuals who want the black bird: Brigid O’Shaughnessy (Mary Astor), the beautiful femme fatale, cowardly Joel Cairo (Peter Lorre) and pompously inflated Kasper Gutman (Sydney Greenstreet) and as the falcon comes within their reach their intense greed is sharply etched. Huston also wrote the script.

results.title: The Malta story
results.creator_credit: British Film-Makers Limited, Peter de Sarigny and Brian Hurst
results.brief_description: RAF camera reconnaissance pilot Peter Ross (Alec Guinness) is trapped on the island of Malta when his plane is destroyed enroute to Egypt in a bombing raid. While in Malta, Ross discovers that Italy is planning to invade, but the mission is thwarted as Allied control prevents the attack. With the Allied presence in place, Peter begins the dangerous task of tracing an enemy convoy carrying supplies to the German Army in North Africa, a mission that is fraught with danger, as communication to the Allied forces will alert the enemy to Peter’s position. Cast includes Alec Guinness, Jack Hawkins, Anthony Steel, Muriel Pavlow and Flora Robson.

results.title: The Mallet = Malj (D)
results.brief_description: In a futuristic antiseptic food factory, workers select healthy chicks while the rejects are carried along a conveyor belt until they are crushed by a mallet and dropped into a garbage bin. A single black chick appears among the yellow and is shoved toward the garbage bin. Before the mallet strikes the gasping chick rebels. A terrifying vision of Social Darwinism, rendered as a haunting and powerful allegory. Without narration. Winner of the 1979 Melbourne Film Festival short film competition. NB: CONTAINS DISTURBING IMAGES

results.title: The Mallee tree
results.creator_credit: Dean Lawry, David Meagher, Jason White, Astrid Scott and ACMI Content Development
results.brief_description: With its roots deeply set in the earth the humble Mallee finds its strength to face the uncertain challenges of nature. Its tenacity to survive and live on through long droughts and harsh weather conditions is symbolic of the Birchip community who also face similar challenges in their own lives. Written and performed by Glenys Rickard.

results.title: The Mallee Fowl
results.creator_credit: David Moore and Peter Du Cane
results.brief_description: Mallee Fowl are the most remarkable of the world’s mound-building birds. The male bird builds a huge conical mound like a compost heap, which acts as an incubator for hatching the eggs. This fascinating documentary looks at the life-style of this unusual bird.
results.description: Mallee Fowl are the most remarkable of the world’s mound-building birds. The male bird builds a huge conical mound like a compost heap, which acts as an incubator for hatching the eggs. This fascinating documentary looks at the life-style of this unusual bird.

results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: The Mallee fowl
results.brief_description: An account of the nesting habits of the Mallee Fowl. These birds are members of the family Megapodirdae - the mound builders. They do not brood their eggs but lay them on a bed of organic matter in a mound of earth, leaving them to be incubated by heat from fermenting vegetable matter and the natural heat of the sun. The male bird carefully adjusts the mound so that the varying amounts of heat from the two sources maintain the temperature at 92 degrees fahrenheit.
